March 24, 1974: Fiction
BURR, by Gore Vidal. (Random House, $8.95.) A wicked entertainment about the
conventional textbook villain.
COME NINEVEH, COME TYRE, by Allen Drury. (Doubleday, $8.95.) Another
political melodrama, this time about a dim-witted President and a pacifist cabal.
JAWS, Peter Benchley. (Doubleday, $6.95.) "Better close for winter, Caleb. Big
shark et up all the summer people."
THE SNARE OF THE HUNTER, by Helen MacInnes. (Harcourt Brace Jovanovich,
$7.50.) Thrust and counterthrust, chases and Byzantine maneuvers and a reliable
pro at work.
THE HONORARY CONSUL, by Graham Greene. (Simon & Schuster, $7.95.) God
works in devious ways in this thriller-comedy about a kidnapped British diplomat.
NICKEL MOUNTAIN, by John Gardner. (Knopf, $6.95.) A modern pastoral set in
upstate New York about a middle-aged man who marries a young girl.
THE PARTNERS, by Louis Auchincloss. (Houghton Mifflin, $6.95.) The gentle
moralist of Wall Street charts the destinies within a big law firm.
THEOPHILUS NORTH, by Thornton Wilder. (Harper & Row, $7.95.) Old-
fashioned novel about a compulsive Good Samaritan in ca. 1920's Newport.
TUESDAY THE RABBI SAW RED, by Harry Kemelman. (Arthur Fields
Books/Dutton, $6.95.) Rabbi Small applies Talmudic ratiocination to solve a
murder on campus.
THE EYE OF THE STORM, by Patrick White. (Viking, $8.95.) The 1973 Nobel
Prize-winner's novel about a dying tyrannical old woman.
March 24, 1974
Non-Fiction
PLAIN SPEAKING, by Merle Miller. (Putnam's, $8.95.) An "oral biography" of
Harry Truman, with some salty opinions on a variety of things.
YOU CAN PROFIT FROM A MONETARY CRISIS, Harry Browne. (Macmillian,
$8.95.) Investment strategies that will allegedly keep you solvent.
HOW TO BE YOUR OWN BEST FRIEND, by Mildred Newman, Bernard
Berkowitz with Jean Owen. (Random House, $4.95.) Stop defeating yourself and
start living!
THE JOY OF SEX, by Alex Comfort. (Crown, $12.95.) Sophisticated eroticism but
basically just another how-to.
ALISTAIR COOKE'S AMERICA, by Alistair Cooke. (Knopf, $15.) The debonair
television commentator's ramble through American history.
MANAGEMENT, by Peter F. Drucker. (Harper & Row, $15.) A rather ponderous
but ambitious attempt to systematize the study of management.
THE SECRET LIFE OF PLANTS, by Peter Tompkins and Christopher Bird.
(Harper & Row, $8.95.) Fascinating experiments in communication with plants.
UPSTAIRS AT THE WHITE HOUSE, by J.B. West with Mary Lynn Kotz. (Coward,
McCann & Geoghegan, $8.95.) Reminiscences of five Presidents by a former
White House major domo.
IN ONE ERA AND OUT THE OTHER, by Sam Levenson. (Simon & Schuster,
$6.95.) A mishmash of funny stories and haimishe homilies that may just be your
glass tea.
THE BEST OF LIFE, by David E. Scherman. (Time/Life Books, $19.95.) A
sumptuous, nostalgic collection of the most memorable photographs from the
magazine.
